Text: The Boston Celtics grinded out their sixth win in a row, defeating the Toronto Raptors 99-95 at Air Canada Centre on Wednesday night. The game was decided in the final two minutes by the hand of ex-Raptor Leandro Barbosa, who off the bench, scored 12 of his 14 points in the final quarter. Kevin Garnett led the Celtics (25-23) with a season-high 27 points and 10 rebounds, while Courtney Lee added 15 points. Paul Pierce had a double-double of 12 points and 11 rebounds, with six assists and Avery Bradley and Brandon Bass scored 11 and 10 points, respectively
